.slick-slider
{
    position: relative;

    display: block;
    box-sizing: border-box;

    -webkit-user-select: none;
       -moz-user-select: none;
        -ms-user-select: none;
            user-select: none;

    -webkit-touch-callout: none;
    -khtml-user-select: none;
    -ms-touch-action: pan-y;
        touch-action: pan-y;
    -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
}

.slick-list
{
    position: relative;

    display: block;
    overflow: hidden;

    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
}
.slick-list:focus
{
    outline: none;
}
.slick-list.dragging
{
    cursor: pointer;
    cursor: hand;
}

.slick-slider .slick-track,
.slick-slider .slick-list
{
    -webkit-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
       -moz-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
        -ms-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
         -o-transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
            transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}

{
    position: relative;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;

    display: block;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
}
.slick-track:before,
.slick-track:after
{
    display: table;

    content: '';
}
.slick-track:after
{
    clear: both;
}
.slick-loading .slick-track
{
    visibility: hidden;
}

{
    display: none;
    float: left;

    height: 100%;
    min-height: 1px;
}

{
    float: right;
}

{
    display: block;
}

{
    display: none;

{
    pointer-events: none;
}

    visibility: hidden;
}

}

    display: none;

class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 18, 2020 7:18 PM">1 year ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->3 weeks<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Honestly, what do you expect? It's next-gen. The console itself to begin with looks like some type of alien object that's casually placed in your living room. The controller is fantastic, much bigger so it can grip in my hands properly now. I always liked the PS4 controller but now holding this I can see how much less of a controller it is compared to the PS5's. Lastly, you honestly won't get the full next-gen experience until HDMI 2.1 4k monitors come out that runs over 120hz. So if money is a little tight I would wait till it dies down. Not worth paying over retail for this console. So if you were thinking of buying it from those scalpers don't.</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div I haven't put it down since I got it. The controller is on another level and don't get me started with the graphics. I recommend purchasing a monitor compatible to get full 120 FPS on games that are capable because the graphics are next level. I went with the digital version, and that being said it comes with more than enough storage for all your games. let me tell you that this totally worth. Anyway, you always will need to buy an external drive (I prefer SSD) for your digital games. What about disk games? You can still play them in your old ps4, is not a big difference (load speed is the only difference that I notice) if is a normal game that doesnt support a ps5 upgrade. Otherwise, I recommend virtual games because they cant break and you always will have them in your library, so if you travel a lot like me, and you want to bring your ps5 with you, you dont need to care for make some space in your baggage for a bundle of discs.</p></div><div class="d-block d-md-none"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div the ps5 ($500) and the digital edition $400 or what ever the price was?</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Sep 18, 2020 3:17 PM">1 year id="answer-fc8b87e4-65ff-3aa1-a14c-94286e6d3a68" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components ugc-line-clamp"><div class="  " style="height: auto; max-height: none;"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span>&nbsp;<span>The more expensive one can play game discs. the cheaper version can only download games; no physical copies can be played on it.</span></div></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Sep 18, 2020 4:55 PM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Prime</p><div class="vote-and-further-action
